column1: Copy of Crocker Family Recipes Metadata chart - Sheet1

column8: description
column14: identifier

column8: Apple Crisp; eight macintosh apples (peeled, slices), cinnamon to taste 1 tblspn water; Place in a buttered purex pan or pie crust dish; Topping: seven tblspn butter, 1 cup sugar, 3/4 cup flour mix together spread over apples; Bake for thirty mins at 350 degrees
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Baked Brie; one pkg pillsbury crescent rolls one pkg brie cheese 6 inch wheel, brown sugar dried cranberries roasted pecans; open rolls cut in half place cheese one one half with brown sugar, roasted pecans, dried cranberries place other square on top and seal shut; Whisk 1 egg with 1 tblspn water and brush over dough; Bake at 350 degrees for 20 mins
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Blackberry Lime Cupcakes; Preheat oven 350, makes 24; med bowl sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda; Cream butter and sugar until pale and fluffy; Add lime zest; Add eggs one at a time; beat in vanillia and lime juice; Add half flour mixture and then half milk until fully added; Beat until combined; Bake cupcakes for 12-14 mins until golden brown; Compote: Add berries, sugar, zest and juice to half cup water bring to boil until reduced then lower heat pass through seive and leave to cool; Frosting: beat butter until light and fluffy, add everything but compote beat on high for six minutes until light and fluffy; Add compote, whip by hand for one to two mins
column14: green peapods on a white card

column8: Blended Golden Mojito; Sugar for coating 1 cup gold (light) rum 1/3 cup sugar 12 mint leaves 1 lime wedge 1/2 cup lime juice 4-5 cups of ice cubes; Blend rum lime juice sugar until sugar dissolves; add 4 cups of ice cubes; add mint leaves; blend until small green flecks; garnish with lime wedge and any left over mint leaves
column14: green card with multicolored circles surrounding it

column8: Boursin Cheese; 2 cloves of garlic 8 oz of butter 16 oz cream cheese softened 1 tsp dill 1 1/2 tsp chives 1/2 tsp chives 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 tsp basil 1/4 tsp pepper 1/2 tsp marjurum; Melt butter add to cream cheese in bowl add spices and blend; Refrigerate -- Make a day ahead
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Brownies; Preheat to 350; 4 sq. of Bakers unsweetened baking choc 3/4 cup butter 2 cup sugar 1 cup flour 3 eggs 1 tsp vanilla nuts optional; melt choc. and butter, stir in sugar eggs and vanilla; add flour; mix well; Spread into 9x9 pan; Bake for 30-35 mins
column14: red border with white spots

column8: Crab Puffs; 5-6 eggs 2 1/2 - 3 cups flour 2-3 tblspn garlic powder white pepper to taste 2 lbs crab meat blend oil for frying; Mix flour into beaten eggs; Add crab garlic powder and white pepper to taste; Heat oil drop puffs into oil for 4-5 mins; makes 50 puffs
column14: red border with small white spots white background and watermelon in the corner

column8: Cranberry Martini; 1 giggle = 1.5 fl oz vodka 1.5 fl oz orange liquer 1.5 fl oz dry vermouth 3 fl oz cranberry juice 1 cup ice cranberries; Shake and pour
column14: green card with multicolored circles surrounding it

column8: Cumin Chicken Stew; 3 onions halved, sliced thin 3 garlic cloves minced 3 carrots sliced short 3 ribs celery 3 red bell peppers 1 stick unsalted butter  1 bay leaf 1/2 tblspn cayenne pepper 2 tblspn cumin 2 tblspn curry 1/2 tpspn cinnamon 1/2 tsp all spice 1/2 tblspn corriander 1/2 tsp black pepper 1 tsp salt 1 tblspn tomato paste 35 oz plum tomomatoes chopped 5 cups chicken broth 5-6 lbs chicken 1/3 cup jasmine rice small head caulifloer 1 lb green beans 2 small zuchini chopped 1 lb shrimp (optional) 1/4 cup parsley; In 8 qrt kettle cook onion garlic carrots celery and peppers, stir in curry powder bay leaf, and rest of spices; Stir over moderate heat for 3 mins; Stir in tomatoe paste, tomatoes and chicken stock; Place chicken in pot and let simmer for 30 mins; Take chicken ut and cut into bite sized pieces; Add cauliflower green beans and simmer for 5 mins; Add zuchinni and chicken and shrip; add parsley; Option to add roasted penuts cooked lima bean red chili peppers plain yougurt golden raisens scallions yellow bell peppers
column14: green card with multicolored circles surrounding it  and blue card with overlapping circles

column8: Dark Chocolate Caramel Cupcakes; bake at 350 for 12-15 mins; 1 cup flour 1 cup sugar 1/3 cup cocoa powder 1tsp baking powder 1/2 tsp salt 1 egg room temperature 1/2 cup strong coffee hot 1/4 cup vegetable oil 1 1/2 tsp vanilla; Buttercream 5 egg whites room temp 1 1/4 cup sugar 1 1/2 cup (3 sticks) unsalted butter room temp 2 tsp vanilla 1/2 cup salted caramel sauce; Sift together all dry ingredients in a electric mixer; combine all wet ingredients in med bowl and whisk; Mix dry ingredients and combine dry and wet ingredients mix together for 2 mins, scrape down sides and mix 1 more min; Batter should be thin, distribute between cupcake liners; Buttercream whisk together egg whites and sugar in pan over simmering water; whisk until warm and sugar is dissolved -- 2-3 mins; Whisk egg mixture on med then high speed for 5 mins to form stiff glossy peaks and merange has cooled; reduce speed to med and add paddle attachment, add butter 1 piece at a time add vanilla and salted caramel sauce
column14: green peapods on a white card

column8: English Muffins Hor Dourvers; 1 1/2 cup grated cheddar cheese 1/2 cup chopped scallions 1 cup ripe olives chopped 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper 1/2 cup mayonnaise 1/2 tsp salt; mix well, spread over toasted english muffins; place under broiler under melted and cut into quarters
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: French 75 Cocktail; Ice 1 oz hendrick gin 1/2 oz lemon juice 1/4 oz simple syrup 1 oz ginger liquor 4-5 oz champange or presecco
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Halfway Cookies; 1 cup of butter 1/2 cup sugar 1 tsp vanilla 2 cup siftede flour 1 tsp of baking powder 2 egg whites beaten until stiff 1/2 cup brown sugar 1 tblspn water 2 eggs lightly beaten 1/2 tsp salt 1 pck chocolate chips; Cream butter and eggs add egg yolks water vanilla and dry ingredients; Spread on cookie sheet place chocolate chips on top; Add brown sugar to egg whites beaten spread over chocolate chips; Bake for 25 mins at 350
column14: red border with a strip of green and a christmas tree with yellow stars at the top and sides and yellow dots on it

column8: Lynn's Cow Plops; Bake at 375 for 3-5 mins; 3/4 cup of sifted flour 1/2 tsp baking soda 6 tblspn sugar 1/2 tsp vanilla 1 egg 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 cup melted butter 6 tblspn brown sugar 1/4 tsp water 1 cup chocolate chips; Mix flour salt and baking soda seperatly; Blend together sugar butter and vanilla; Beat in egg; Add flour mixture; Add chocolate chips; use pam on cookie sheet
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Martha Lucas' Cheese Straws; 1 lb cheddar cheese 1 egg 1 3/4 cup flor 1/4 tblspn cayenne pepper 1 stick butter 1 tblspn water 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 tblspn paprika; Cream butter and cheese mix spices salt and flour add to butter mixture; Chill dought for 10 mins; roll out with a cookie machine with a straw tooth disc; Bake 18-20 mins at 350
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Mushroom and Leek Soup; 1/2 cup heavy cream 3 tsp thyme 6 tblspn unsalted butter 6 cups chicken stock 2 lbs cremini mushrooms 3 lg leeks 6 tblspn flour 1 1/2 tsp salt 3/4 tsp pepper; Beat cream until soft peaks form fold in thyme; refrigerate for 2 hours; Cook mushrooms 1st in 2 tblspn butter in stock pot, remove; In a 4 qt stock pot over med heat melt 2 tblspn butter stir in leeks cook for 5 mins add mushrooms to leeks; Sprinkle in flower stir in chicken brother salt and pepper; Bring to boil then simmer for 20 mins; Add cream
column14: green card with mutlicolored circles around it and a blue card with interlocking circles

column8: Orange Smoothie; 2 cups orange juice 1 cup milk 2/3 cup sugar 1 tsp vanilla 1 cup ice cubes; Mix together in blender
column14: red header with rooster in the corner

column8: Tiny Tim Cranberry Tarts; for crust 8 tblspn unsalted butter room temp 3 oz cream cheese 1 cup flour; for filling 1 lg egg 3/4 cup sugar 2 tblspn unsalted butter room temp 1 tsp vanilla 1/2 cup chopped walnuts 3 oz fresh cranberries; Preheat 325; mini tarlet; combine butter cream cheese and flour until forms doughy ball; cut into 24 pieces; for filling beat eggs sugar butter vanillia; mix well; stir in nuts and 3 cranberries in eat muffin tin; Add filling; Bake 20-25 min until golden brown
column14: green card with multicolored circles around it and a blue card with interlocking circles

column8: Turkey Pear Tartiner; 1 baguette 1 1/2 cups left over turkey unsalted butter room temp 1/3 lb roquefort cheese or blue cheese 1 whole pear thinly sliced honey and minced chives for garnish; preheat broiler slice baguette in half lengthwise; generously butter each half broil until browned; place turkey, cheese and pear on halves broil until cheese bubbles; Toast walnuts in dry pan on med heat for 5 mins finely chop walnuts; sprinkle over slices; Add honey and chives
column14: green peapods on a white card

column8: Yogi Tea; 1 gallon water 1/2 vanilla bean split 1 tblspn peppercorns 1 tblspn ground cloves 3 tblspn cardamon seeds 1/2 cup ginger peeled and rough cut 5 cinnamon sticks; Boil for 1 hour
column14: red header with rooster in the corner
